rComments: I had Dr. Ursell at Emory. He was the most engaging teacher I've ever had. I was never bored, and I learned new things. There are so many literature classes that you can fall asleep during. THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM. I was excited to go to class. He was fair, kind (almost to a fault) helpful, and enthusiastic. Attendance/ participation earns the "A"

Best in class experience I have had. Strict when he needs to be and enthusiastic always. Allows his students to learn for themselves rather than to achieve a standard, and in this way, anyone should enjoy a class with him. I wish he wasn't moving from Emory so that I might take a class with him as a senior.

Awesome! If you don't take a class with him you are missing out. Dr. Ursell is helpful, fair, and understanding. Best professor I had all year and maybe of all time. His classes are a must. He wants you to do your best and will help you get there plus he is adaptable and understands college students are busy!

Wow! What an awesome teacher! He's so nice and charming, and he really knows his stuff. He also makes students feel good about their contributions to class, and he's totally available outside of class to talk about papers or other things. I HIGHLY suggest taking his course or just talking to him.

Michael is a great professor! He is very helpful and is passionate about his material. I took core with Michael and it was a pleasant experience, he is always cordial and upbeat which helps the energy of the classroom. Discussions and essays will be the bulk of your grade, although the essays are all manageable and help is always an email away.

Professor Ursell is very passionate about the subject, which made it easier to learn and made the class more interesting.  His lectures are also very interactive and he is always keen on hearing what students have to say.  He's also just downright adorable.

Mike is adorable. What a wonderful professor! I had him last quarter, for Shakespeare, and he's only improved. He's very enthusiastic about the class, engages with students, and clearly loves his job. He makes the class very enjoyable. He leads a wonderful class! Highly recommended!
Shakespeare class. He was great. Crystal clear and presented interesting analysis of the works. He is by far the clearest professor I've ever had(I'm a junior). Just do the work!
Passionate about what he talks about, but you won't be very interested unless you're a classics major
Great teacher.  Knows a lot!  Kind of tough grader but very helpful, I've sent him drafts the day before they're due.  If you need help ask, be active, he's great.
Not a bad teacher. Attendance is important. Assignments are not difficult. Language analysis is illuminating, but his interest is sometimes heavily theoretical.
